intro: Lindelofia anchusoides subsp. macrostyla, commonly known as the large-styled lindelofia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a hairy texture that aids in moisture retention.
